Restrictions module

Restriction functions used to limit the available neighbors in a search iteration according to set rules.

restrictions.out_of_bounds(neighbor_pos, state_grid)

Checks if neighbor is outside of the boundaries of the state grid. Used in neighbor_positions_restricted().

Parameters

  • neighbor_pos¶ (Pos) – Node position of considered neighbor node.

  • state_grid¶ (StateGrid) – To the current path modified state grid.

Returns

bool

restrictions.collided_obstacle(current_pos, neighbor_pos, state_grid, part_id)

Checks if the path from current_node to neighbor_node obstructs any obstacles or transitions. Used in neighbor_positions_restricted().

Parameters

  • current_pos¶ (Pos) – Node position of currently expanded node.

  • neighbor_pos¶ (Pos) – Node position of considered neighbor node.

  • state_grid¶ (StateGrid) – To the current path modified state grid.

  • part_id¶ (int) – Part ID of the neighbor node.

Returns

bool

restrictions.neighbor_position_restricted(current_pos, neighbor_pos, relative_neighbor_pos, state_grid, part_id)

Checks if neighbor violates positional restrictions. Used in path_finding_util.search_algorithm.find_path()

Parameters

  • current_pos¶ (Pos) – Node position of currently expanded node.

  • neighbor_pos¶ (Pos) – Node position of considered neighbor node.

  • relative_neighbor_pos¶ (Pos) – Relative node position of neighbor

  • state_grid¶ (StateGrid) – To the current path modified state grid.

  • part_id¶ (int) – Part ID of the neighbor node.

Returns

bool

restrictions.goal_restricted(part_id, pos, direction, goal_dict)

Checks if the direction restriction of the goal is violated.

Parameters

  • part_id¶ (int) – Part ID of Node.

  • pos¶ (Pos) – Node position to check.

  • direction¶ (Pos) – Direction of node.

  • goal_dict¶ (DirectionDict) – See goal_dict

Returns

bool

restrictions.get_restricted_neighbor_nodes(directions, goal_dict, current_pos, part_stock, predecessors, fast_mode, key, start_pos, transition_points)

Determines what neighbors are reachable from the current position and with the available parts. Removes neighbors that violate goal restrictions.

Parameters

  • part_stock¶ (PartStock) – See PartStock

  • predecessors¶ (Predecessors) – See Predecessors

  • fast_mode¶ (bool) – See fast_mode

  • key¶ – Key for getting predecessor to the currently expanded node. Type depends on if fast_mode is set.

  • directions¶ (set [Pos]) – Directions in which neighbors are considered.

  • goal_dict¶ (DirectionDict) – Directions in which the goal can be appended to.

  • current_pos¶ (Pos) – The position of the currently expanded node.

  • predecessors¶ – See Predecessors

  • start_pos¶ (Pos) – See start_pos

  • transition_points¶ (set [Pos]) – Set of node positions that are marked as transition points.

Returns

obj`Nodes<type_aliases.Node>`.

Return type

A set of restricted neighbor
